strIntroduction: Spend the day in the pleasant company of the world's friendliest giants at the Elephant Sanctuary, see the elephants in their natural habitat and have fun giving them a bath Meet one of the world's largest and friendliest animals in a natural and protected environment Learn about the Elephant Relocation Team that has been moving elephants who have lost their habitats since 1974 Under the rangers' supervision, you will get to have fun while giving the elephants a bath Don't forget to take plenty of photos to keep as memories or reminders of the sanctuary's important and noble work Meet one of the world's largest and friendliest animals in a natural and protected environment Learn about the Elephant Relocation Team that has been moving elephants who have lost their habitats since 1974 Under the rangers' supervision, you will get to have fun while giving the elephants a bath Don't forget to take plenty of photos to keep as memories or reminders of the sanctuary's important and noble work What We Love:   What We Love: Meet one of the most majestic animals in the world — the mighty elephant — in a conservation area dedicated specifically to them. Established all the way back in 1989 by the Department of Wildlife and National Parks, the Elephant Sanctuary is a great place to see how elephants live and interact in a natural environment. If you are ready to get up close and personal, you will get a chance to bathe the elephants using special brushes — under the watchful eye of the park rangers, of course. You will also get to learn about the sanctuary's efforts to relocate the elephants whose habitats have been threatened and discover the challenges facing the friendly giants in today's rapidly developing world.

Relax and unwind in the calm, quiet and authentic fishermen's island Pulau Ketam Leave the busy city behind and journey to the slow-paced island of a traditional crab village Discover this rare and traditional fishing village, part of a small cluster of islands on the coast to the east of KL Get snap happy with Crab Island's iconic 'floating houses', perched above sea level Indulge in a delicious lunch of the village's famed local seafood Leave the busy city behind and journey to the slow-paced island of a traditional crab village Discover this rare and traditional fishing village, part of a small cluster of islands on the coast to the east of KL Get snap happy with Crab Island's iconic 'floating houses', perched above sea level Indulge in a delicious lunch of the village's famed local seafood What We Love:   What We Love: Pulau Ketam, a small island located off the coast of Klang, has earned itself the nickname of "Crab Island". Home to a large fishermen community, the island's signature symbols are its "floating houses", perched on wooden stilts above sea level. The island is the perfect place to leave the city's hustle and bustle behind and truly experience the lifestyle of a fisherman. No air pollution, no traffic jams, no crowds or queues - the ultimate escape. With an abundance of fresh seafood, the island offers a wide range of seafood dining options.

Forget your worries and remember what it's like to be a child again in Malaysia's exciting amusement park, i-City Spend a fun filled day at i-City, an amusement park for both the young and young at heart Access the park's main attractions with the convenient i-Card Less than an hour away from Kuala Lumpur, i-City offers plenty of options for the whole family A variety of attractions are available, from the icy wonderland of SnoWalk to the scary surprises of Horror House Make a visit to the City of Digital Lights and take photos with celebrities at the Red Carpet Wax Museum Spend a fun filled day at i-City, an amusement park for both the young and young at heart Access the park's main attractions with the convenient i-Card Less than an hour away from Kuala Lumpur, i-City offers plenty of options for the whole family A variety of attractions are available, from the icy wonderland of SnoWalk to the scary surprises of Horror House Make a visit to the City of Digital Lights and take photos with celebrities at the Red Carpet Wax Museum What We Love:   What We Love: Enjoy a day of unlimited fun in Malaysia with a visit to i-City, a family amusement park and a true wonderland for kids and adults alike. With a variety of attractions and less than 60 minutes away from Kuala Lumpur, it's the best place in town for a family day. Don't miss SnoWalk, a winter wonderland hailed as Malaysia's largest snow park. Check out the whole park from the top of the Ferris Wheel or join the crème de la crème at the Red Carpet Wax Museum. Face your fears head on at the Horror House and take interesting photos at the Trick Art Museum. Long story short, being bored at i-City in Malaysia is simply not an option.

The tour sums up with a relaxing coffee break at an old school coffee house where you can see the city's history in photos of the past and present.

Discover the cultural and historical heritage of Kuala Lumpur on an exciting 5 hour tour with visits to the city's oldest temples and bustling markets Dive into history and tradition of Kuala Lumpur, getting to know the city's unique mixed background Visit the Kuala Lumpur's oldest Buddhist, Hindu and Taoist temples Shop till you drop at the Central Market and sample exotic delicacies in Chinatown Watch how Kuala Lumpur's many cultures, religions and traditions co-exist peacefully within a step of each other Dive into history and tradition of Kuala Lumpur, getting to know the city's unique mixed background Visit the Kuala Lumpur's oldest Buddhist, Hindu and Taoist temples Shop till you drop at the Central Market and sample exotic delicacies in Chinatown Watch how Kuala Lumpur's many cultures, religions and traditions co-exist peacefully within a step of each other What We Love:   What We Love: Discover Kuala Lumpur's rich historical heritage, age-old traditions, peculiar customs and more on the full day Culture and Heritage Tour. Experience a diverse mix of cultures that make Kuala Lumpur the exciting and versatile city that it is and peek into its intricate and exciting past. On this tour, you will get to visit one of the largest and oldest Buddhist temples in Malaysia, the oldest Hindu Temple in Kuala Lumpur as well as the city's oldest Taoist temple, Sze Yeh Temple. Swing by the Kuala Lumpur Central Market and explore the bustling Chinatown, the perfect place to polish your bargaining skills.

See the best of Penang in less than half a day: visit the Kek Lok Si Temple, climb the 7 tier Pagoda and hop on the Penang Hill Furnicular Train! Enjoy an event-filled four hour guided tour of Penang and stop by its major attractions Take the funicular train for a great view of Georgetown from the top of Penang Hill Explore a beautiful Buddhist temple, Kek Lok Si, with its stunning architecture and sculptures Get an insight into local culture from your informative English speaking guide Enjoy an event-filled four hour guided tour of Penang and stop by its major attractions Take the funicular train for a great view of Georgetown from the top of Penang Hill Explore a beautiful Buddhist temple, Kek Lok Si, with its stunning architecture and sculptures Get an insight into local culture from your informative English speaking guide What We Love:   What We Love: Have a great time exploring Penang, even if you only have four hours. After a convenient hotel pick up, you will get to see a number of key attractions in the city. This compact tour takes you to new heights – literally – you will get to rise 833 metres above sea level aboard the funicular train ride to the top of Penang Hill. In addition to the memorable climb, you will see the 30.2 meter bronze statue of Guanyin, the Goddess of Mercy, during your visit to the Kek Lok Si Temple and marvel at the 7 Tier Pagoda of the 10,000 Buddhas. By the end of the tour, you'll have ticked off many of Penang's key sights.

See the famous heritage landmarks of Penang by winding though its old narrow streets on a trishaw See Penang from another angle, from the backseat of a trishaw, an authentic three-wheeled taxi Cover most of the UNESCO World Heritage Site area in merely three hours See Fort Cornwallis, Penang Town Hall, Beach Street, Kapitan Keling Mosque and more Soak up tales of local history from your informative trishaw driver and guide See Penang from another angle, from the backseat of a trishaw, an authentic three-wheeled taxi Cover most of the UNESCO World Heritage Site area in merely three hours See Fort Cornwallis, Penang Town Hall, Beach Street, Kapitan Keling Mosque and more Soak up tales of local history from your informative trishaw driver and guide What We Love:   What We Love: Immerse yourself in a truly authentic Penang experience with a tour in a traditional trishaw. The popular three-wheeled taxi will take you on an exciting adventure, letting you enjoy great sights and breathe in the atmosphere of Malaysia's streets and bustle. Cycle past the core of the city's UNESCO World Heritage Site: Fort Cornwallis, Penang Town Hall, Beach Street and Khoo Kongsi, an elaborate Chinese clan house, Achech Street, Kapitan Keling Mosque and more. Complete the tour with a visit to Penang's Little India

strIntroduction: Explore Penang through a generous serving of Malaysia's best dishes on the 3 hour Heritage on a Plate Tour with both lunch and dinner tour options With so much to see and do in Penang, make sure you leave time for this compact journey into the best of Malaysian cuisine Travel to 4 different tasting locations and sample up to 6 different variations of Malaysia cuisine See the city come alive at lunch time or dinner time and enjoy an authentic Malaysian meal Let your English speaking host explain more about the foods you're eating and share a nation-wide passion for these dishes With so much to see and do in Penang, make sure you leave time for this compact journey into the best of Malaysian cuisine Travel to 4 different tasting locations and sample up to 6 different variations of Malaysia cuisine See the city come alive at lunch time or dinner time and enjoy an authentic Malaysian meal Let your English speaking host explain more about the foods you're eating and share a nation-wide passion for these dishes What We Love:   What We Love: Discover George Town through delicious, flavorful and diverse Malaysian cuisine. This exciting tour will let you taste and sample some of the best dishes the locals have come to know well and love. It's a tour to the very soul of Penang, letting you explore its traditions and culture through authentic food. On the three hour tour, you will get to stop at four different tasting locations and try up to six different types of cuisine around the city. From spicy to mild and from substantial to light, you will get to eat like a local in one of Malaysia’s most exciting cities.
strTitle: Heritage on a Plate Food Tour

strIntroduction: Speed through Georgetown's night streets and see a whole different side to Penang See Penang after sunset and discover Georgetown's more playful side Start with a flavorful introduction to the local cuisine with a dinner from a local hawker's stall Roam through the city in the back of a traditional three-wheeled taxi, the trishaw Enjoy great views from Penang Bridge and journey back to the island by ferry See Penang after sunset and discover Georgetown's more playful side Start with a flavorful introduction to the local cuisine with a dinner from a local hawker's stall Roam through the city in the back of a traditional three-wheeled taxi, the trishaw Enjoy great views from Penang Bridge and journey back to the island by ferry What We Love:   What We Love: Watch Georgetown come alive by night, transforming into a bright bustling metropolis. Start off with a signature dinner right from a hawker's stall, sampling the best of Malaysian cuisine made in the best of its cooking traditions, such as satay, fried rice or sizzling hot plate noodles. With a delicious dinner filling your stomach, hop into the back of a trishaw and enjoy a scenic ride across Malaysia's second longest bridge, Penang Bridge. The tour concludes with a ferry ride back to Penang Island where you'll get to see all of the area's unique nighttime beauty from the water.

Explore Georgetown Tour takes you on an immersive discovery of Penang's capital, its architecture and sights in just four hours This compact tour will take you to the most interesting historical spots in the city Having once been an important trade centre, Georgetown is renowned for its diverse international architecture Visit famous attractions like State Museum, Fort Cornwalls, Reclining Buddha and more This compact tour will take you to the most interesting historical spots in the city Having once been an important trade centre, Georgetown is renowned for its diverse international architecture Visit famous attractions like State Museum, Fort Cornwalls, Reclining Buddha and more What We Love:   What We Love: Penang is a popular tourist destination in Malaysia and its capital Georgetown is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. A fusion of different people, cultures and traditions, Georgetown used to be a major trading hub in the Straits of Malacca. The city was known for its colorful architecture, combining British colonial buildings, Chinese shophouses and mosques. In just four hours, you will get to see some of the best sights Georgetown has to offer and what makes it a truly unique city that cannot be found anywhere else in Asia

Explore Penang's historical capital on the Georgetown Heritage Tour and see the city's prime attractions and sights Visit Penang's exciting capital – Georgetown – a modern metropolis and a city with old historical traditions Visit old Chinese temples Hock Teik Cheng Sin and Cheah Kongsi See an old luxurious mansion and learn about the city from your English speaking guide Visit Penang's exciting capital – Georgetown – a modern metropolis and a city with old historical traditions Visit old Chinese temples Hock Teik Cheng Sin and Cheah Kongsi See an old luxurious mansion and learn about the city from your English speaking guide What We Love:   What We Love: The vibrant dynamic region of Penang comes with lots to offer – and its capital Georgetown is one of the main destinations. The entire city is UNESCO World Heritage Site and is a mecca of ancient monuments, historical landmarks and museums. Led by your English speaking and informative guide, you'll visit Khoo Kongsi, a Chinese clanhouse with stunning architecture and - Hock Teik Cheng Sin Temple. Don't miss one of the oldest clan temples in town – the Cheah Kongsi. The Pinang Peranakan Mansion, a must see for every traveler visiting Penang, is a rich museum that showcases the traditions and culture of a Peranakan family including a recreated home of a wealthy resident to give you a glimpse into the past life of the rich and powerful

Kayaking, jet skiing, fly fishing, sunbathing, parasailing, fish feeding and more - the choice is yours on this exciting Sapi and Manukan Islands trip Explore 2 of Malaysia's most beautiful islands Manukan and Sapi Take a dip in the transparent waters of Manukan Island with its sandy beaches and great recreational facilities Use your free time well: go kayaking, parasailing, jet skiing, try Sea Walking and more Enjoy a delicious barbecue lunch by the beach Explore 2 of Malaysia's most beautiful islands Manukan and Sapi Take a dip in the transparent waters of Manukan Island with its sandy beaches and great recreational facilities Use your free time well: go kayaking, parasailing, jet skiing, try Sea Walking and more Enjoy a delicious barbecue lunch by the beach What We Love:   What We Love: Journey to Malaysia's two beautiful islands: Sapi and Manukan. First, take a boat to Manukan Island for its crystal clear turquoise seas and vivid greenery. The island is ready to welcome you with the arranged recreational facilities: picnic zones, changing rooms, tables and more – so you can enjoy the water and white sandy beach in full. After a delightful barbecue lunch, head over to Sapi Island where you will have loads of free time to enjoy kayaking, ride a banana boat, go jet skiing and more. If you are looking for a safe way to explore the underwater world, try Sea Walking, a new sport that allows you to explore the ocean without the need for scuba duving classes.

Discover Malaysia's rich wildlife, bathe in a sulphur hot spring, shop at a local vegetable market and more! Explore Malaysian nature at one of its most beautiful parks, Kinabalu Park See the exotic flora and fauna in Malaysia's first UNESCO World Heritage Site Dip into a hot sulphur bath in Poring Hot Spring and relax as you gaze up at giant bamboo trees As an optional extra, visit the Desa Cattle Dairy Farm, Kundasang Vegetable Market and more Explore Malaysian nature at one of its most beautiful parks, Kinabalu Park See the exotic flora and fauna in Malaysia's first UNESCO World Heritage Site Dip into a hot sulphur bath in Poring Hot Spring and relax as you gaze up at giant bamboo trees As an optional extra, visit the Desa Cattle Dairy Farm, Kundasang Vegetable Market and more What We Love:   What We Love: Pay a visit to one of the world's most stunning natural environments – Kinabalu Park, home to thousands of bird and animal species. Declared a UNESCO World Heritage site in 2000, it was the first park in Malaysia to be awarded the title. Stop at Poring Hot Spring, named after a species of the giant bamboo that grows in the area. Known for its sulphur hot spring baths, it's a great spot to relax after the long journey. If you prefer to keep going, leave the bath for later and enjoy a visit to the Butterfly Farm. Another option is a longer tour, complete with a visit to Desa Cattle Dairy Farm, where you will get to feed sheep and watch them graze in the fields.

Explore Sabah's breathtaking countryside on a train journey to Padas River before a thrilling water rafting adventure Hop in a raft for a challenging adventure down the magnificent Padas Gorge Discover Sabah's beautiful countryside as you travel by train journey from Beaufort to Pangi White water rafting is a great way to get your blood going whilst also being safe for beginners Hop in a raft for a challenging adventure down the magnificent Padas Gorge Discover Sabah's beautiful countryside as you travel by train journey from Beaufort to Pangi White water rafting is a great way to get your blood going whilst also being safe for beginners What We Love:   What We Love: Water rafting is a great activity for beginners and pros alike. Journey to Beaufort Railway Station for a train ride to Pangi, passing through stunning Sabah countryside. Upon your arrival, take a break over some light refreshments and safety instructions before heading for your 10km rafting voyage. Feel the thrill as your raft speeds through the rapids of the glorious Padas River. Gushing through spectacular Padas Gorge, it's the ultimate Borneo adventure and not for the fainthearted!

The Kawa Kawa Fireflies Sunset Cruise will let you explore Malaysia's wildlife and nature in one of its most beautiful parts of Sabah at Kawa Kawa Village See a stunning sunset as you cruise along Kawa Kawa Village and its beautiful countryside Don't miss a chance to see Malaysia's cutest inhabitants: the elusive Proboscis Monkeys Relax over dinner onboard and get ready for a night show of dancing fireflies See a stunning sunset as you cruise along Kawa Kawa Village and its beautiful countryside Don't miss a chance to see Malaysia's cutest inhabitants: the elusive Proboscis Monkeys Relax over dinner onboard and get ready for a night show of dancing fireflies What We Love:   What We Love: Located about 112km northeast of Kota Kinabalu, Kawa Kawa is an enchanting little village and, for most visitors, love at first sight. The village's vivid greenery and beautiful landscapes serve as the perfect playground for Malaysia's famous Proboscis Monkeys. The untouched natural oasis is a great place to spot rare wildlife, so hop on a river cruise that takes you past their habitats and keep your camera ready. After a delicious dinner of local delicacies, you will even get to see an evening fireflies show, watching the little light bugs fire up the sky.

Leave your worries behind as you step into Tamau Cilipadi Village to admire its amazing landscapes and wildlife before hopping on a river cruise for an electric fireflies show and buffet dinner Travel to Sabah to experience the true meaning of zen in the quiet little village of Tamau Cilipadi See a stunning countryside sunset over mangrove forests and paddy fields Keep your eyes sharp for a chance to spot the rare Proboscis Monkeys Conclude the adventure with a river cruise complete with a fireflies show and buffet dinner Travel to Sabah to experience the true meaning of zen in the quiet little village of Tamau Cilipadi See a stunning countryside sunset over mangrove forests and paddy fields Keep your eyes sharp for a chance to spot the rare Proboscis Monkeys Conclude the adventure with a river cruise complete with a fireflies show and buffet dinner What We Love:   What We Love: Quaint remote little corners that will let you reload and re-energize away from the noise and crowds are few and far between. That's why we are sure you will simply love your time in Tamau Cilipadi Village. Located about a hundred kilometers to the North Eats of Kota Kinabalu, this hidden oasis boasts paddy fields, mangrove forests and is home to the rare Proboscis Monkeys. See the sun set over this little paradise as you head for a magical fireflies cruise for an amazing light show and a delectable buffet spread.
strTitle: Tamau Cilipadi Wildlife & Sunset Fireflies Cruise

strIntroduction: Go on an thrilling adventure down Kiulu River Get an adrenaline boost with a white water rafting trip down Kiulu River Kiulu River is great for beginners and suitable for children, thus making it a great family bonding activity Experience the longest white water rafting trip in Borneo which is 15km long After rafting for almost 2 hours, savor a delicious BBQ lunch and roundtrip hotel transfers included in both packages Get an adrenaline boost with a white water rafting trip down Kiulu River Kiulu River is great for beginners and suitable for children, thus making it a great family bonding activity Experience the longest white water rafting trip in Borneo which is 15km long After rafting for almost 2 hours, savor a delicious BBQ lunch and roundtrip hotel transfers included in both packages What We Love:   What We Love: Seeking an adventure? You've come to the right place. Whether you love the feeling of adrenaline rushing through your blood, want to burn off some calories or simply enjoy trying new things, white water rafting is a popular activity in Sabah. Kiulu River is perfect for a rafting adventure and is suitable for both beginners and experienced rafters

Experience the untouched beauty of Weston Wetlands, enjoy a buffet dinner whilst watching fireflies and spot Borneo's famous monkeys Visit Weston Wetland, one of the largest wetlands in Sabah and a naturally stunning place Marvel at beautiful landscapes and keep your eyes open for proboscis monkeys Enjoy a river safari with a delicious buffet, a sunset view and a fireflies show Your English speaking guide will tell you all about the wetland Visit Weston Wetland, one of the largest wetlands in Sabah and a naturally stunning place Marvel at beautiful landscapes and keep your eyes open for proboscis monkeys Enjoy a river safari with a delicious buffet, a sunset view and a fireflies show Your English speaking guide will tell you all about the wetland What We Love:   What We Love: Malaysia is full of secret spots that have not yet become popular tourist destinations. This makes them an absolute heaven for travelers seeking something different, quiet and unspoilt. Weston Wetland is one of the most naturally beautiful areas in Borneo with marvelous views, stunning sunsets and rich wildlife. After your arrival, enjoy a set of light refreshments at the lodge. Go on a river safari and look out for wildlife including Proboscis Monkeys, and soak up the wonderful views as the sun sets. Relax over a buffet dinner then marvel at a night fireflies show before heading back to Kota Kinabalu.
strTitle: Weston Wetlands Monkey, Sunset & Fireflies Cruise

strIntroduction: Dive into an amazing adventure in Malaysia's hidden paradise – Mantanani Island: snorkel, go on a river cruise and explore the rich local fauna Visit the magical Mantanani Island for some of the best snorkeling in the world You may get a chance to spot the island's cutest attraction – dugongs or "sea cows" Choose between two packages: Snorkeling Only and Snorkeling + Kawa Kawa River Cruise Discover coral reefs, enjoy a buffet onboard the cruise, watch fireflies and so much more! Visit the magical Mantanani Island for some of the best snorkeling in the world You may get a chance to spot the island's cutest attraction – dugongs or "sea cows" Choose between two packages: Snorkeling Only and Snorkeling + Kawa Kawa River Cruise Discover coral reefs, enjoy a buffet onboard the cruise, watch fireflies and so much more! What We Love:   What We Love: Veer off the beaten track, beat tourist crowds and explore the hidden Malaysian oasis of Mantanani Island, a great location for diving, snorkeling, bird watching and more. Located off the north-west coast of the state of Sabah, Malaysia, the island is home to many marine animals. You will have two fun options to choose from, depending on your preferences: a snorkeling only package or snorkeling plus a Kawa Kawa River cruise. The first one takes you to the best locations for exploring the underwater world with an abundance of coral reefs. Whilst the river cruise option also lets you relax over a buffet dinner while observing fireflies. You choose!
strTitle: Mantanani Snorkeling & Kawa Kawa River Cruise

strIntroduction: Explore Garama Village and meet its cutest inhabitants, proboscis monkeys; hop on a fiberglass boat and see fireflies light up the sky after enjoying a buffet meal See Borneo's proboscis monkeys in their natural habitat while visiting Garama Village Go for a memorable voyage on a fiberglass boat with a delicious buffet dinner onboard Watch fireflies dance in the sky as you cruise through the peaceful river See Borneo's proboscis monkeys in their natural habitat while visiting Garama Village Go for a memorable voyage on a fiberglass boat with a delicious buffet dinner onboard Watch fireflies dance in the sky as you cruise through the peaceful river What We Love:   What We Love: Pay a visit to a truly unique place – Garama Village in the Southwest of Sabah, home to Borneo's indigenous proboscis monkeys with their unique facial features! On this eight hour tour, you will get to watch these exotic animals in their natural habitat. But first, enjoy a warm welcome in the village with homemade cakes and coffee before hopping onto a fiberglass boat and watching fireflies dance across the darkness whilst enjoying a delectable buffet dinner. The tour concludes after arriving back to Kota Kinabalu and a delicious visit to the chocolate outlet.

Discover the culture, traditions and foods of 5 Malaysian tribes on a visit to Mari Mari Cultural Village Mari Mari Cultural Village is located in a remote forest setting in Kionsom - the perfect escape from the urban bustle Enjoy a truly authentic experience by observing the lives of 5 indigenous Malaysian tribes Sample different cuisines and watch traditional performances: blow-pipe making, fire starting and more Choose one of three tour times to suit your schedule Mari Mari Cultural Village is located in a remote forest setting in Kionsom - the perfect escape from the urban bustle Enjoy a truly authentic experience by observing the lives of 5 indigenous Malaysian tribes Sample different cuisines and watch traditional performances: blow-pipe making, fire starting and more Choose one of three tour times to suit your schedule What We Love:   What We Love: Visit a place filled with legends, myths, mystery and magic. Mari Mari Cultural Village is a unique location showcasing the culture and lifestyle of five ethnic Sabah communities: the Bajau, Lundayeh, Murut, Rungus and Dusun. You will get a chance to see first hand a variety of unique traditional activities: blow-pipe making, tattooing and even fire-starting as well as learn about the locals' beliefs and culinary specialties. Watch a cultural performance to understand the Mari Mari even better and enjoy an authentic meal before heading back to your hotel.

Explore Kota Belud's landscapes and rivers on a Klias River Fireflies Safari Cruise and get a chance to see Proboscis Monkeys in their natural habitat Experience Kilas Wetlands and marvel at its beauty Explore stunning mangrove forests and catch a glimpse of the Proboscis Monkeys Sample local cuisine on board the river cruise while watching the sun sink into the river See fireflies dance in the night sky on the fireflies cruise before heading back to Kota Kinabalu Experience Kilas Wetlands and marvel at its beauty Explore stunning mangrove forests and catch a glimpse of the Proboscis Monkeys Sample local cuisine on board the river cruise while watching the sun sink into the river See fireflies dance in the night sky on the fireflies cruise before heading back to Kota Kinabalu What We Love:   What We Love: Klias Wetland is a mangrove forest reserve and a destination quickly gaining popularity with tourists. Catch it before it becomes a tourist hotspot and experience the best of Kilas while it's still quiet and pristine. One of the major attractions is, of course, the chance to spot the rare Proboscis Monkeys. The tree-dwelling celebrities typically show up after sunset, so make sure you keep your eyes out for them as you sail along the river. You'll also enjoy a delicious dinner onboard and watch fireflies dance in the night sky.

Answer these questions and more on a guided tour of Vietnam's Cu Chi tunnels Discover the hidden underground world of Vietnam's complicated network of tunnels Learn about the complicated and incredibly inventive lives of the tunnel residents Pay a visit to a local family to learn about Vietnam's history and culture first hand Gain insight into the life in the area in both past and present Discover the hidden underground world of Vietnam's complicated network of tunnels Learn about the complicated and incredibly inventive lives of the tunnel residents Pay a visit to a local family to learn about Vietnam's history and culture first hand Gain insight into the life in the area in both past and present What We Love:   What We Love: Attend the most exciting history lesson ever! Learn about Vietnam's guerilla war by climbing into the underground tunnels that played a crucial part in the fight. Built by local fighters during the Indochina conflict, the Cu Chi tunnels served as base for Viet Cong, the National Liberation Front, where the local soldiers and residents used to eat, sleep, work, cook and even go to school. Started in 1948 as a hiding place from French air attacks, by 1965 the tunnel was estimated to consist of an astounding 200 km of tunnels. It included almost everything needed for the life of local inhabitants: hospitals, schools, meeting rooms, kitchens and more. You will get to see and explore it all on the Cu Chi Tunnels tour.

Marvel at the ornate building facades famed for their neo-Romanesque style - evidence of the French influence on Vietnam. Moving on, you'll head along the Saigon River ending up at the Opera House, a significant spot during the Second World War. The tour continues on to Reunification Palace where North Vietnamese Army tanks ended the war in 1975. Travel in time through this fascinating city from significant eras of history to the present day with your informative private guide.

Avoid the traffic and cruise your way down the Saigon River by luxury speedboat, from which you'll be able to observe daily river life and the many picturesque 'weekend' homes that now line the river bank. When you arrive your enthusiastic guide will help to bring the war to life by walking you through the tactics that were used by these ruthless fighters. If you're feeling brave enough, descend into the cramped tunnels for a taste of what life was like a guerrilla soldier on the front line. Once your tour is over, you'll be taken through the beautiful countryside to a local cricket farm. Many Vietnamese consider crickets a delicacy, and you'll have the opportunity to try these unique treats (only if you fancy it!). Tuck in to a tasty traditional lunch to top off this culturally rich day.

Head to one the world's oldest Chinatowns and see, hear and taste the soul of Cho Lon. You'll tour the town the traditional way by being chauffeured on a cyclo (a three-wheeled bicycle taxi). Stopping along the way you'll be immersed in Chinese culture with a visit to Bihn Tay Market, filled with quintessential Chinese artifacts like calligraphy artwork, paper lanterns and traditional medicine. Foodies will also be able to enjoy this tour with stops in the fruit markets to try exotic fruits and a pitstop for Vietnam's famous coffee. Before the tour ends, you will board a restored traditional rice barge to enjoy lunch and a master class in cooking authentic Vietnamese cuisine.

You'll be taken to a brick factory and a small homemade coconut processing plant, where you'll learn how oil, candy and mats are made for the local markets. As you cruise the crisp waters, you'll have the opportunity to take part in a lively cooking demonstration, before indulging in a delicious three-course lunch of local delicacies. Go back in time to the days of the Dinh and Le dynasties and explore the ruins of the ancient capital of Hoa Lu then enjoy a leisurely boat cruise before discovering the famous Three Caves Visit the spectacular ruins of the ancient capital of the Dinh and Le dynasties Enjoy a relaxing boat cruise to the marvellous Tam Coc (Three Caves) Glide past the area's incredible karst mountain scenery Tuck in to a tasty local lunch Transfers to and from your hotel plus your English speaking private guide are included Visit the spectacular ruins of the ancient capital of the Dinh and Le dynasties Enjoy a relaxing boat cruise to the marvellous Tam Coc (Three Caves) Glide past the area's incredible karst mountain scenery Tuck in to a tasty local lunch Transfers to and from your hotel plus your English speaking private guide are included What We Love:   What We Love: Delve into the past and discover the ancient capital of the Dinh and Le dynasties, renowned for extraordinary ruins that have survived a millenium. The surrounding scenery is absolutely breathtaking, so make sure you've got a camera to hand to capture the breathtaking scenes. Your enthusiastic local guide will show you some of Vietnam's most authentic cuisine for lunch, before you embark on a relaxing boat cruise. Prepare to be mesmerised as you paddle by the imposing Three Caves (Tam Coc) that dominate the area, and the limestone karst mountains that rise into the sky out of luminous rice fields and you'll see why Hoa Lu is also known as 'Halong Bay on land'. Hit the streets of Hanoi in a guided food tour that's guaranteed to make your mouth water Discover the backstreets and local markets in the Old Quarter of Hanoi Visit Hanoi's best street food spots guided by your resident foodie and Hanoi expert Say cheers with one of Hanoi's local brews Try some of the best savory dishes and finish the night with a local dessert Discover the backstreets and local markets in the Old Quarter of Hanoi Visit Hanoi's best street food spots guided by your resident foodie and Hanoi expert Say cheers with one of Hanoi's local brews Try some of the best savory dishes and finish the night with a local dessert What We Love:   What We Love: This street food tour will give you the best introduction to traditional Hanoi fare whilst exploring the bustling Old Quarter. Sit down at one of the pop-up restaurants and treat yourself to some famous Vietnamese grilled skewers. Make sure to save space for the last stop at one of Hanoi's most well known ice cream parlours. Feel the natural rhythm of the stunning Sapa mountains, marvel at the tranquility of its green valleys and explore one of Vietnam's most scenic regions in full. This 2-day tour kicks off with a trip to Lao Cai and right upon your arrival in Sapa, you get to relax over lunch at a local restaurant. Your main challenge for the day will be a 4-hour trek to Lao Chai, Ta Van and Giang Ta Chai villages. Your second day starts early in the morning with a drive to Cat Cat village to visit and learn about the H’mong ethnic minority, after which you can take a break over lunch and enjoy some leisure time in town. Don’t forget to think about where you want to stay: you can sleep over at a hotel or pick the homestay option.

strIntroduction: Embark on your perfect evening in Hanoi with a water puppetry show, delicious Hanoian meal and a taste of Vietnamese cafe culture led by an informative guide Experience Hanoi's Water Puppetry Show, famed in Vietnam Tuck into a meal and try some of Hanoi's specialities Take the chance to get a local insight into Vietnamese culture from your Hanoi native guide End the evening with a special Vietnamese coffee (the unique flavor of 'egg coffee' is a particular treat!) Experience Hanoi's Water Puppetry Show, famed in Vietnam Tuck into a meal and try some of Hanoi's specialities Take the chance to get a local insight into Vietnamese culture from your Hanoi native guide End the evening with a special Vietnamese coffee (the unique flavor of 'egg coffee' is a particular treat!) What We Love:   What We Love: Plan a perfect night out in Hanoi with this special guided tour. Start the night by watching Hanoi's famed Water Puppet Show, an impressive showcase originating from Northern Vietnamese villages in the 11th century. The show incorporates puppets, music and dance mimicking the traditional folk tales of Vietnam. Once the show ends, tuck into an authentic Hanoian dinner at a Cha Ca restaurant. This restaurant is known for serving the 200-year-old Vietnamese specialty dish infusing white fish in saffron oils, served with a variety of greens and washed down with a glass of Bia Ha Noi, the local brew. Complete your evening in one of the many street cozy side cafes with a cup of the famous Vietnamese coffee in hand.

Delve into the past and present of Vietnam's capital to get an excellent overview of the history and culture of Hanoi on this full day private tour Take a tour of Hanoi's past with your English speaking guide Visit Ho Chi Minh's Mausoleum, the Temple of Literature and the imperial citadel Savor a delicious traditional Vietnamese lunch Enjoy a 30 minute cyclo tour through the vibrant Old Quarter Sip on a famous cup of Vietnamese coffee while you take in the view of Hoan Kiem Lake Take a tour of Hanoi's past with your English speaking guide Visit Ho Chi Minh's Mausoleum, the Temple of Literature and the imperial citadel Savor a delicious traditional Vietnamese lunch Enjoy a 30 minute cyclo tour through the vibrant Old Quarter Sip on a famous cup of Vietnamese coffee while you take in the view of Hoan Kiem Lake What We Love:   What We Love: Explore the formative years of Hanoi including the days under French colonial rule and Ho Chi Minh's campaign for independence beginning with a visit to Ho Chi Minh's Mausoleum. Next, visit the imperial citadel, the apex of regional political power for more than a millennium which is still being excavated. Enjoy a traditional Vietnamese lunch before visiting the Temple of Literature, a relic from the 11th century built as an homage to Confucius, the Chinese scholar and philosopher. See the iconic Long Bien Bridge, a relic of French colonial rule crossing the Red River. Ride a cyclo and stroll past the heart of Hanoi, the beautiful Old Quarter, a collection of 36 narrow streets that were named for the products sold from their shops - Bamboo and Tin Streets still sell the same wares as they did years before! Get your caffeine fix at the end of the tour with a strong dose of Vietnamese coffee then round off the day with a picture taken with the beautiful downtown skyline as a background.
strTitle: Story of Hanoi Private Day Tour

In this tour of Hanoi your experienced tour guide will take you to some of the most historically significant places whilst relating some of the turbulent history of Vietnam. Start the day at Ho Chi Minh's Mausoleum to recount the leader's movement for independence from French colonial rule. Ho Chi Minh's body was preserved after his death in 1969 and continues to be visited by thousands of people every year. Afterward, take the chance to stroll through the Presidential Palace grounds and see the one pillar pagoda temple. The Temple of Literature is well worth a stop, this beautiful 11th Century temple is dedicated to Confucious. Next you'll hop on a cyclo and breeze through the Old Quarter learning about daily Hanoi life and the 36 streets selling local wares.

Looking for a different way to see Hanoi? This food tour around the Old Quarter will let you see the busy metropolis in a new light, or rather – taste What's your favorite Vietnamese dish? Find out on a fun food tour in Hanoi's Old Quarter Try a myriad of local delicacies, from french influenced Vietnamese banh mi and bun cha noodles to sweet milk dessert and fruity drinks Be led to one of few egg coffee shops to sample this truly unique drink Learn about the history and landmarks of Hanoi's Old Quarter from your English speaking guide What's your favorite Vietnamese dish? Find out on a fun food tour in Hanoi's Old Quarter Try a myriad of local delicacies, from french influenced Vietnamese banh mi and bun cha noodles to sweet milk dessert and fruity drinks Be led to one of few egg coffee shops to sample this truly unique drink Learn about the history and landmarks of Hanoi's Old Quarter from your English speaking guide What We Love:   What We Love: From spicy noodle soups to fried meats, pancakes and sweet desserts like tapioca – the food tour around Hanoi's Old Quarter will let you experience it all. Dive into the wonderful aromas of the busy food stalls as you explore Old Quarter with your knowledgeable English speaking guide. You will have two options to choose from: either starting your tour at 11:30am and hitting the local diners in time for lunch or setting off at 6:00pm when the city is in the midst of preparing for dinner! Before you get to filling your stomach with local delicacies, you get to learn about the history of Old Quarter and its cultural landmarks from your informative guide. With loads of new facts to keep your mind busy, you can now finally dig in!

Discover the ancient artistic trades of Vietnam in villages know for ceramic and silk production on this full day tour from Hanoi led by a private guide Watch as ceramics are made before your eyes and learn about a family tradition that is centuries old Visit a 17th century pagoda - one of the most picturesque landmarks in the area Witness the making of delicate silk creations in Van Phuc Village Enjoy a local lunch included on the tour Hotel transfers and a local English speaking guide are included in the private tour Watch as ceramics are made before your eyes and learn about a family tradition that is centuries old Visit a 17th century pagoda - one of the most picturesque landmarks in the area Witness the making of delicate silk creations in Van Phuc Village Enjoy a local lunch included on the tour Hotel transfers and a local English speaking guide are included in the private tour What We Love:   What We Love: Embark on a tour through centuries of cultural history as you discover the wonderful ancient crafts of Vietnam. Your first stop will be the quaint village of Bat Trang, where families have been producing ceramics by hand for over 400 years! You'll not only get to witness the creation process first hand; your enthusiastic local guide will also tell you all about the history of this century old trade as you watch. From there you'll be taken to see the But Thap Pagoda - one of the most stunning sites in the area situated along the picturesque Duong River. Replenish with a delicious local lunch before heading to Van Phuc Village, the most famous silk village in all of Vietnam. Prepare to be mesmerized as you stroll through the scenic streets of this unique town - you'll even have the chance to purchase some of the wonderful creations made here on your way through. For art lovers and culture admirers alike, it's a wonderful insight into Vietnam's rich handicraft history.

Take home more than just pictures from tour trip to Vietnam – pick up a new recipes and cooking techniques to impress your friends for years to come! Discover the best of Vietnamese cuisine and learn how to recreate some of its culinary bests See a different side of Hanoi on the 5 hour cooking class and a food market shopping spree Unveil the best kept secrets of Vietnam's culinary traditions and bring some of the recipes home Be guided by an experienced chef and enjoy direct hotel pick up Discover the best of Vietnamese cuisine and learn how to recreate some of its culinary bests See a different side of Hanoi on the 5 hour cooking class and a food market shopping spree Unveil the best kept secrets of Vietnam's culinary traditions and bring some of the recipes home Be guided by an experienced chef and enjoy direct hotel pick up What We Love:   What We Love: This 5 hour home cooking class in Hanoi is a delicious adventure leading you to uncover age old secrets behind some of Vietnam's most popular dishes. Kick off early in the morning or later in the afternoon by picking up a few useful phrases in Vietnamese – make sure to take notes, you will definitely need those later. You will go on to shop at the local market for all the necessary ingredients: herbs, spices, vegetables, meats, fishes and fruits. With the shopping done, you head to the villa where your cooking class will take place. Here you will learn how to create a number of stunning dishes under the watchful eye of the local chef. Lastly, you will get to enjoy the meal you have prepared with wonderful views of Red River and Long Bien Bridge.

Travel through Hoa Lu's scenic countryside, go on a boat cruise in Tam Coc, visit ancient temples and more, all on a day trip from Hanoi Explore Vietnam's ancient capital city, Hoa Lu, on an immersive 10-hour adventure Take stunning photos on the Tam Coc river voyage – a true treat for budding nature phtotograhers Discover the full diversity of Vietnamese natural landscapes as you pass through limestone karsts and stone caves Visit the temples of Dinh and Le dynasties and explore ancient relics remaining from when Hoa Lu was the country’s capital Enjoy convenient roundtrip hotel transfers from Hanoi and the services of an informative guide Explore Vietnam's ancient capital city, Hoa Lu, on an immersive 10-hour adventure Take stunning photos on the Tam Coc river voyage – a true treat for budding nature phtotograhers Discover the full diversity of Vietnamese natural landscapes as you pass through limestone karsts and stone caves Visit the temples of Dinh and Le dynasties and explore ancient relics remaining from when Hoa Lu was the country’s capital Enjoy convenient roundtrip hotel transfers from Hanoi and the services of an informative guide What We Love:   What We Love: Back in 968 and until 1009 (under the Dinh Dynasty), Hoa Lu was the capital city of Vietnam. And even though the title was taken by Thăng Long in 1010, the city remains a treasury of historical interest to this day. The Hoa Lu - Tam Coc Day Trip takes you on an exciting adventure through natural and cultural landmarks. After hotel pick up in Hanoi, you start off in Ninh Binh and hop on a boat in Tam Coc. Passing through caves and limestone karst formations, you get to explore Vietnam’s landscape in all its diversity. After lunch at a local restaurant, you go on to visit the temples of Dinh and Le Dynasty before heading back to Hanoi.
strTitle: Hoa Lu - Tam Coc Day Trip

strIntroduction: Enjoy stunning natural landscapes, explore mysterious caves, go on a boat trip, see the largest Buddha in Vietnam and more! See the largest pagoda in Vietnam – the Bai Dinh Pagoda, finished only recently in 2015 Explore the Trang An Cave Complex, a scenic area renowned for its boat cave tours Take a break over an authentic Vietnamese lunch and try local specialties Enjoy convenient roundtrip transfers from Hanoi and professional private guide services See the largest pagoda in Vietnam – the Bai Dinh Pagoda, finished only recently in 2015 Explore the Trang An Cave Complex, a scenic area renowned for its boat cave tours Take a break over an authentic Vietnamese lunch and try local specialties Enjoy convenient roundtrip transfers from Hanoi and professional private guide services What We Love:   What We Love: Discover Majestic Trang An Tour is the best way to explore Vietnam’s natural beauty in full. After a convenient Hanoi hotel pick up, you are whisked away to one of the area’s most important landmarks, Bai Dinh Pagoda – the largest pagoda in Vietnam. Discover the place of Buddhist worship and admire the largest bronze Buddha statue in the whole country. Stop over at a local restaurant for an authentic Vietnamese lunch of popular delicacies before heading to the majestic cave complex of Trang An. Hop on a boat cruise to see Sang Cave (Bright Cave), Toi Cave (Dark Cave) and Nau Ruou Cave. Around 6:00pm, you'll head back to Hanoi and be dropped off directly to your hotel.

From memorials and museums to pagodas, lakes and vllages – see all this and more on a 7 hour tour of Hanoi Discover Hanoi on an immersive one day adventure to its best attractions Pay a visit to the late Mr Ho Chi Minh at the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum See the city's stunning pagodas: Tran Quoc Pagoda and One Pillar Pagoda Explore amazing natural scenery along the Hoan Kiem Lake, visit the Temple of Literature and Bat Trang ceramic village or Museum of Ethnology Have the option to see the unique water puppet show or take a city cyclo ride at the end of the tour Discover Hanoi on an immersive one day adventure to its best attractions Pay a visit to the late Mr Ho Chi Minh at the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum See the city's stunning pagodas: Tran Quoc Pagoda and One Pillar Pagoda Explore amazing natural scenery along the Hoan Kiem Lake, visit the Temple of Literature and Bat Trang ceramic village or Museum of Ethnology Have the option to see the unique water puppet show or take a city cyclo ride at the end of the tour What We Love:   What We Love: You'll be surprised how much of Vietnam's former capital you can see in one day – all it takes is the right planning. On this 7 hour tour of the city you will get to discover Hanoi's true character through its natural landscapes, museums, places of worship and more. Right after a convenient pick up from your hotel, you will visit the Ho Chi Minh Complex – a traffic-free area of monuments, memorials and botanical gardens, accompanied by an informative explanation from your guide. Go on to see the One Pillar Pagoda and Tran Quoc Pagoda before stopping by the Temple of Literature, Vietnam's first national university. After a relaxing lunch, there will still be time left for a trip to Hoan Kiem Lake, Bat Trang ceramic village and more. At the end of the tour, there's the option of a water puppet show, traditional cyclo tour, or avoiding the traffic mayhem to be delivered seamlessly back to your hotel.

Explore the historical Hanoi on this walking and cyclo tour of notable temples, churches, colonial houses, markets and desserts! Ride by French colonial houses on a 'cyclo' rickshaw Visit an ancient citadel, a Catholic church and a Taoist temple Snack on Vietnamese dishes and taste test wedding cake Experience the flurry of a Hanoi market then relax with a Vietnamese coffee Ride by French colonial houses on a 'cyclo' rickshaw Visit an ancient citadel, a Catholic church and a Taoist temple Snack on Vietnamese dishes and taste test wedding cake Experience the flurry of a Hanoi market then relax with a Vietnamese coffee What We Love:   What We Love: Explore the historical parts of Hanoi by foot and by cyclo. Start the tour by hopping aboard a cyclo, a traditional rickshaw, and begin the afternoon traveling through the bustling old quarter, along streets lined with French colonial houses. Once you've reached the Northern Gate of the ancient citadel discover the beautiful Cua Bac Church - a notable example of Catholic influence in the city. You'll then move onto Quan Thanh Temple one of the oldest Taoist temples before heading towards West Lake, hearing the story of John McCain as a Vietnamese Prisoner of War as you stroll. Make a pitstop at Pho Cuon Restaurant for a bite to eat before heading to Chau Long market to get a feel for local life including a walk through a famous dessert street and a wedding cake street (you'll even get to sample a few!) Shake off the sugar rush at Hang Ga Street, the mat weaving borough, then end the tour with a famous Vietnamese coffee at one the many streetside cafes.

Explore Bac Ha and its vibrant weekly market on a day trip near Sapa Visit the region's busiest Sunday market - Sapa Bac Ha Watch villagers of every local ethnicity selling their produce, hailing from all corners of the countryside Visit the bizarre but beautiful palace built to entertain Hoang A Tuong Enjoy a traditional lunch at an authentic village and experience true local life Visit the region's busiest Sunday market - Sapa Bac Ha Watch villagers of every local ethnicity selling their produce, hailing from all corners of the countryside Visit the bizarre but beautiful palace built to entertain Hoang A Tuong Enjoy a traditional lunch at an authentic village and experience true local life What We Love:   What We Love: Head from Sapa to the usually sleepy town of Bac Ha which comes alive every Sunday as eager patrons descend on the Bac Ha Market, the largest in the region. Soak up the vibrant atmosphere and observe the mix of ethnic minority traders that make their weekly pilgrimage to the market from the surrounding mountainous areas. Browse the colourful stalls stocking a variety of local products, including brightly coloured handicrafts and fresh tea. Reach the northern edges of the town to visit Hoang A Tuong’s palace, or Vua Meo, a rather outlandish part exotic church, part French chateau hybrid, constructed by the French in 1921 in an unusual ‘oriental baroque’ style. Afterwards, wander the charming hamlet of Trung Do Village, the rustic home of the Tay ethnic minority group. Settle down for a tasty lunch prepared by a local Tay family and get a glimpse of village life. End the day with breathtaking views as you cruise down the Chay River by boat before heading back to Sapa Town.

Pedal around the rural district of Mai Chau, a collection of ethnic villages framed with green meadows and valleys, accessible on a day trip from Hanoi Take a trip northwest of Hanoi for a chance to explore Vietnam’s unspoilt countryside See Mai Chau's famous stilt houses that rises up to 12 feet off the ground Visit Pom Coong and Na Phon villages and have lunch with a local ethnic group Take part of the tour to pedal through rice paddies and rural settlements Enjoy convenient hotel transfers from Hanoi and the knowledge of an English speaking guide Take a trip northwest of Hanoi for a chance to explore Vietnam’s unspoilt countryside See Mai Chau's famous stilt houses that rises up to 12 feet off the ground Visit Pom Coong and Na Phon villages and have lunch with a local ethnic group Take part of the tour to pedal through rice paddies and rural settlements Enjoy convenient hotel transfers from Hanoi and the knowledge of an English speaking guide What We Love:   What We Love: Travel 130 kilometres away from Hanoi and discover the quaint authentic rural district of Mai Chau in Hoa Binh province. The village is well-known among visitors for its stilt houses or pile dwellings, made of bamboo and timber. The houses are elevated up to 12 feet above the ground to avoid water damage, protecting them from the elements. The village is surrounded by green rice fields, valleys and hills and lets you fully indulge in the natural beauty of Vietnamese countryside. Travel along Thung Khe Pass, bike through rice paddies and lunch with the White Thai ethnic group. Led by a professional English speaking guide, this tour including roundtrip hotel transfers, is a great day trip from Hanoi to discover rural life and expansive nature.

A day of trekking, walking and cycling at the spectacular Ba Vi Mountain and ancient Duong Lam Village Visit the highlights in the west of Hanoi with an English speaking private guide Marvel at the wonderful views of the Ba Vi Mountain and Da River Enjoy lunch with local residents of Duong Lam Village Ride around this national heritage area by bicycle Visit the highlights in the west of Hanoi with an English speaking private guide Marvel at the wonderful views of the Ba Vi Mountain and Da River Enjoy lunch with local residents of Duong Lam Village Ride around this national heritage area by bicycle What We Love:   What We Love: Begin your day of exploration with a two hour ride to the west of Hanoi and take in the marvellous Ba Vi Mountain along the way and the terraced landscapes where locals grow crops. Burn off calories with a short trek through the cloud forest and enjoy the great view of the Da River. You will then descent to the Duong Lam Village, where some of the buildings are over a hundred years old. Get the unique chance to communicate with villagers as you eat your lunch at a local home. The adventurous day ends with the leisurely bicycle ride around the village's winding alleyways.

See Hue on a full or half day tour of its iconic sights or go on a relaxing cruise down the Perfume River Get an immersive introduction to the old architectural wonders of Hue on a half day morning tour Leave the busy urban life behind and go on a 4 hour cruise of the Perfume River on the afternoon tour Or, go all in for a full day of Hue discovery pairing up both the morning and afternoon tours Hotel pick up and drop off, plus lunch (morning and full day tours) is included Get an immersive introduction to the old architectural wonders of Hue on a half day morning tour Leave the busy urban life behind and go on a 4 hour cruise of the Perfume River on the afternoon tour Or, go all in for a full day of Hue discovery pairing up both the morning and afternoon tours Hotel pick up and drop off, plus lunch (morning and full day tours) is included What We Love:   What We Love: Let this exciting tour take you through the bustling streets, stunning landscapes, unique architecture and famous attractions in Hue. Discover tombs, pagodas, rivers, and legendary temples, and visit the sights that tourists travel the world to see: Thanh Toan Bridge, Minh Mang Tomb, Nam Giao Esplanade and more. Enjoy a relaxing lunch at a local restaurant and take loads of photos to remember. Feeling more like a voyage? Cruise along the Perfume River that got its name from the flowers that float in its waters in autumn. Visit the Imperial Citadel, An Hien Garden House, Thien Mu Pagoda and so much more.

Roar through Hue on a motorbike and avoid the road traffic to discover the city's most stunning attractions: Khai Dinh's tomb, Tu Hieu Pagoda and more Discover Hue on a motorbike tour to see its famous sights on a 6 hour adventure Start the day with an invigorating sip of authentic Vietnamese coffee at a local coffee shop Visit Emperor Khai Dinh's tomb and the historical temple in Thien Mu Pagoda Enjoy a traditional Vietnamese lunch and breathe in the culture and traditions of Hue Hop on the back of your guide's motorbike to get around Hue like a local Discover Hue on a motorbike tour to see its famous sights on a 6 hour adventure Start the day with an invigorating sip of authentic Vietnamese coffee at a local coffee shop Visit Emperor Khai Dinh's tomb and the historical temple in Thien Mu Pagoda Enjoy a traditional Vietnamese lunch and breathe in the culture and traditions of Hue Hop on the back of your guide's motorbike to get around Hue like a local What We Love:   What We Love: Discover the true spirit of Hue by riding past its signature attractions on a motorbike. This adrenaline filled adventure will not only let you explore the city in full, but you'll be doing it in the most exciting way - atop a roaring motorbike! Your tour starts with a convenient hotel pick up and takes you for a relaxing cup of Vietnamese coffee at a local coffee shop. You will then head to the tomb of the Emperor Khai Dinh, the construction of which started in 1920 and took 11 years to complete. Go on to visit other famous attractions like Tu Hieu Pagoda and Tu Duc tomb before stopping for an authentic Vietnamese lunch. Complete the journey with a tremendous view of the seven-story Thien Mu Pagoda.
strTitle: Find the Charm of Hue by Motorbike

strIntroduction: Phong Nha-Ke Bang National Park is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and houses stunning rock formations and beautiful landscapes Visit the one of the world's unique national Parks, Phong Nha-Ke Bang National Park, home to 400 million year old karst mountains Explore stunning natural wonders - the Phong Nha Caves - an amazing sight with various rock formations Discover the full diversity of the Vietnamese landscape with two tour options: Ke Bang Day Trip and Paradise Cave Discovery Both tours include lunch, snacks, water, transportation and English speaking guide services Visit the one of the world's unique national Parks, Phong Nha-Ke Bang National Park, home to 400 million year old karst mountains Explore stunning natural wonders - the Phong Nha Caves - an amazing sight with various rock formations Discover the full diversity of the Vietnamese landscape with two tour options: Ke Bang Day Trip and Paradise Cave Discovery Both tours include lunch, snacks, water, transportation and English speaking guide services What We Love:   What We Love: Discover the amazing diversity of Vietnamese landscape on the Phong Nha Cave Exploration Tour. Named a UNESCO World Heritage Sight in 2003, Phong Nha National Park is home to Asia's oldest karst mountains, dating back 400 million years. This active adventure has everything an explorer is looking for: from relaxing walks to hard mountainous treks, dense forests and breathtaking panoramic views. Explore the banks of Ben Hai River, cross the Hien Luong Bridge, squeeze through tight tunnels, conquer hill tops and and feel the refreshing cool of mountain streams. Enjoy a delicious lunch surrounded by astounding natural beauty and cruise along Son River in a kayak. Two equally appealing options are available for this tour: Paradise Cave Discovery Tour (includes a fairly tough 3 hour hike - the less touristy option) and Ke Bang Day Trip (includes a Son river boat trip to Phong Nha Cave - the more touristy, but less strenuous option).

Discover Hue by cruising Vietnam's famous Perfume River; enjoy a delicious dinner and light paper lanterns on board See Vietnam's famous waterway - the Perfume River - up close on a luxury dinner cruise Leave the noise and crowds behind and enjoy magnificent views from a traditional dragon boat Indulge in a delicious dinner on board the shop with stunning views of mountains, pagodas and temples Light traditional paper lanterns and watch them glide into the night sky See Vietnam's famous waterway - the Perfume River - up close on a luxury dinner cruise Leave the noise and crowds behind and enjoy magnificent views from a traditional dragon boat Indulge in a delicious dinner on board the shop with stunning views of mountains, pagodas and temples Light traditional paper lanterns and watch them glide into the night sky What We Love:   What We Love: Crossing the city of Hue, the Perfume River is one of the city's major landmarks. The river got its name from the orchid flowers that fall into its water in autumn, giving the river a scented aroma and attracting lots of tourists to its banks. Don't miss a chance to see the magnificent sight on a private tour, away from crowds and lines. This luxury dinner cruise will take you past historical temples, pagodas, mountains and conclude with a breathtaking sunset view. You will also get to light paper lanterns from the boat before your return to hotel around 9:00pm.

What's Vietnam's true flavor? Hop on a motorbike and find out with a tour of Hue's best local diners Get your chopsticks ready and explore some of the best Vietnamese restaurants in Hue Discover new and familiar favors: from mild to spicy to sweet - this Hue food tour has it all! Try a variety of local specialties: pancakes, beef vermicelli soup, tapioca dumplings and more Hop on the back of your guide's motorbike to get around Hue like a local Get your chopsticks ready and explore some of the best Vietnamese restaurants in Hue Discover new and familiar favors: from mild to spicy to sweet - this Hue food tour has it all! Try a variety of local specialties: pancakes, beef vermicelli soup, tapioca dumplings and more Hop on the back of your guide's motorbike to get around Hue like a local What We Love:   What We Love: Explore Vietnam through your stomach - by taking a tour of the best Vietnamese cuisine! On this exciting motorbike food tour, you will learn the difference between regional cooking methods and discover characteristically bold flavors. After a convenient pick up right from your hotel, you will be whisked away on a mesmerizing journey into the best of Vietnam's delicacies. Try the famous Hue pancake and Vietnam's popular specialty - beef vermicelli soup. Enjoy flavorful tapioca dumplings and light rice disks topped with shrimp. Looking for something more substantial? Go in for a plate of chopped meat or grilled pork vermicelli. Zip through the traffic by motorbike to experience Hue like a local!

Visit the site of one of history's most defining events on the Hue DMZ Tour taking you to famed battlefields and memorials of the Vietnam War Explore historic locations and battlefields from the Vietnam War on the DMZ Tour in Hue Visit Dakrong Bridge, Khe Sanh combat base, Ho Chi Minh trails and more Visit the Vinh Moc tunnels where local families hid deep underground to protect themselves from the dangers above Relax over an authentic lunch and learn more about the history-defining events of the Vietnam War from your knowledgeable guide Explore historic locations and battlefields from the Vietnam War on the DMZ Tour in Hue Visit Dakrong Bridge, Khe Sanh combat base, Ho Chi Minh trails and more Visit the Vinh Moc tunnels where local families hid deep underground to protect themselves from the dangers above Relax over an authentic lunch and learn more about the history-defining events of the Vietnam War from your knowledgeable guide What We Love:   What We Love: Learn about one of the major conflicts in the world's history, the Vietnam War, on the DMZ Tour in Hue. Explore in depth what kind of impact the conflict has had on the society and see iconic battlefields and ruins. Cross Dakrong Bridge, visit Khe Sanh combat base and Ho Chi Minh trails. Stop by the ethnic minority village and relax over lunch in Dong Ha. The tour continues to Ben Hai River and ends with a stop at the Vinh Moc Tunnels - where 60 families lived to protect themselves from the war above ground. Explore the country's eventful and complicated history at the exact same spots where the action took place.

Discover stunning landscapes and breathtaking architecture on a one day tour from Hue to Da Nang and Hoi An Explore the area from Hue to Danang City and Hoi An with lots of exciting stops See the impressive Son Tra Mountain, known to the soldiers of the Vietnam War as Monkey Mountain Pay a visit to Hoi An Silk Village where you can browse and buy luxury textiles, handmade lanterns and more Stop by Hoi An's Japanese Bridge - an intricately carved structure famed in around the world Hotel pick up and drop off, all transportation, lunch and an English speaking guide are included Explore the area from Hue to Danang City and Hoi An with lots of exciting stops See the impressive Son Tra Mountain, known to the soldiers of the Vietnam War as Monkey Mountain Pay a visit to Hoi An Silk Village where you can browse and buy luxury textiles, handmade lanterns and more Stop by Hoi An's Japanese Bridge - an intricately carved structure famed in around the world Hotel pick up and drop off, all transportation, lunch and an English speaking guide are included What We Love:   What We Love: Travel from Hue to Da Nang City and Hoi An on an eventful one day tour. Its compact yet attraction-rich itinerary will make sure your time in Vietnam is of utmost interest and fun. After a convenient pick up right from your hotel, you will visit Linh Ung Pagoda and go on to Son Tra Mountain, also known as Monkey Mountain and overlooking the Bay of Da Nang and the East Sea. Have a quick delicious lunch before continuing the tour with a visit to Marble Mountain and Hoi An Silk Village. Phuc Kien Temple is a true architectural masterpiece and Tan Ky Ancient House is a historical gem built two centuries ago by an ethnically Vietnamese family.
strTitle: Day Trip from Hue to Da Nang & Hoi An

strIntroduction: Explore the Imperial City in a new way: hop on a cyclo and take in the true atmosphere of Hue, its beautiful landscapes and stunning architecture Discover the best of Hue Old City on a traditional French colonial taxi - the cyclo See the most famous attractions in Hue: Imperial Citadel, Nine Holy Cannons, Ngo Mon Gate and more Ride through the streets and take in the exotic urban landscapes of Vietnam's Imperial City At each stop, your informed English speaking guide will tell you all about the sights you visit Discover the best of Hue Old City on a traditional French colonial taxi - the cyclo See the most famous attractions in Hue: Imperial Citadel, Nine Holy Cannons, Ngo Mon Gate and more Ride through the streets and take in the exotic urban landscapes of Vietnam's Imperial City At each stop, your informed English speaking guide will tell you all about the sights you visit What We Love:   What We Love: See the undiscovered beauty of Hue by riding its streets and past its main attractions on a traditional cyclo. Enjoy this truly authentic way to explore the city. A cyclo is a three-wheeled bicycle taxi that appeared in Vietnam during the French colonial period and has since become a popular way to get around. Hop on and ride through the streets of Hue past the Perfume River. Ride across the Truong Tien Bridge and discover Old Hue City. You will pass lots of must see Hue attractions on the way: the Imperial Citadel, Nine Holy Cannons, Ngo Mon Gate, Thai Hoa Palace, Nine Dynastic Urns, Forbidden Purple City and more.

Delve into the historical roots of Hue by visiting the former Imperial Palace and resting place of emperors on this half day private tour Learn about the former imperial capital of the Nguyen dynasty, Hue, from an experienced English speaking guide Visit two significant landmarks in Hue - the former Imperial Palace and Tu Duc Royal Tomb Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off Learn about the former imperial capital of the Nguyen dynasty, Hue, from an experienced English speaking guide Visit two significant landmarks in Hue - the former Imperial Palace and Tu Duc Royal Tomb Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Begin your half day historical tour with a trip to the ancient walled citadel containing the former Imperial Palace. Surrounded by protective ramparts and a ringed moat, within the citadel is the inner sanctum of the Imperial Palace, also known as the Purple Forbidden City - the architecture After that you'll take a short journey to the surrounding countryside to see the final resting place of former Nguyen emperors at the Tu Duc Royal Tomb. Completed before his death, the scholarly Emperor Tu Duc utilised it as a retreat complete with a lake, pavilion and theatre. Take a stroll along the complex and observe the artistic designs of the tomb and buildings.

See Hue by night and discover this peaceful city's dark side: busy night markets, colorful night life, lively streets and delicious cuisine! Watch the quiet city of Hue come to life right before your eyes as the sun sets Stop by the famous historical attractions: Hue Imperial City, train station, French Schools and more Explore the bustling night market, shop for souvenirs and try exotic snacks See the city in the fastest and most exhilarating way possible — on the back of a motorbike driven by a local female driver Watch the quiet city of Hue come to life right before your eyes as the sun sets Stop by the famous historical attractions: Hue Imperial City, train station, French Schools and more Explore the bustling night market, shop for souvenirs and try exotic snacks See the city in the fastest and most exhilarating way possible — on the back of a motorbike driven by a local female driver What We Love:   What We Love: Indulge in an amazing city experience - explore Hue by night on a motorbike! Watch the inherently peaceful city turn into a colorful bustling metropolis, with lots to discover. Get picked up from your hotel and start the tour on a delicious note - with a sumptuous dinner at a local restaurant that will let you explore all the diversity of Vietnamese cuisine. After dinner, head to Hue Imperial City, a walled fortress and the former imperial capital of Vietnam. Go on to visit Hue French Schools and roam through the busy night market. The tour ends with a visit to Hue Train Station and a hot cup of Vietnamese tea.
