strIntroduction: See the sun rise over this abandoned Hindu temple constructed between the 4th and the 14th century AD by the Kings of Champa My Son temple is an absolute must see for anyone visiting Hoi An See the ancient ruins at sunset and discover the stunning valley around them Visit Thanh Ha Pottery Village or Kim Bong Carpentry Village and meet local craftsmen My Son temple is an absolute must see for anyone visiting Hoi An See the ancient ruins at sunset and discover the stunning valley around them Visit Thanh Ha Pottery Village or Kim Bong Carpentry Village and meet local craftsmen What We Love:   What We Love: The ruins of My Son are considered the largest temple complex of the Champa Kingdom in the coastal area. Bearing the hallmarks of Indian civilization, it is located southwest of Hoi An and lies in a stunning emerald valley. My Son Discovery from Hoi An offers two options to see this incredible landmark. If you are an early bird, go on the My Son Sunrise By Bus Tour, that will let you witness a breathtaking sunrise at the ancient ruins and kicks off at 4:30am. If you prefer a later option, choose the Discover My Son By Bus Tour that start at 8:00am and takes you to My Son well-rested and ready to explore.
strTitle: My Son Discovery from Hoi An

strIntroduction: Spend half a day on a private tour around the significant local highlights of Hoi An with an experienced tour guide Visit the Chua Ong Pagoda and Jinshang Temple, spiritual landmarks of the town Marvel at the symbol of Hoi An, the Japanese Covered Bridge, which is skillfully built with intricate patterns Explore traditional Hoi An architecture at the Tam Ky Ancient House with its back facing the river for the import and export of goods Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off Visit the Chua Ong Pagoda and Jinshang Temple, spiritual landmarks of the town Marvel at the symbol of Hoi An, the Japanese Covered Bridge, which is skillfully built with intricate patterns Explore traditional Hoi An architecture at the Tam Ky Ancient House with its back facing the river for the import and export of goods Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Hoi An is a small but well-preserved former international trading port from the 15th to 18th century that welcomed Chinese, Dutch, French, Japanese, Portuguese and Arab merchants. Start your journey at the Chua Ong Pagoda - built in honor of the Chinese general Quan Cong, a symbol of courage and loyalty. Make an offering and the caretaker will strike a bronze bowl that makes a bell-like sound. Continue on to the Phuc Kien Assembly Hall where the Jinshang Temple is located. With Hoi An's history as a trading port, it is no surprise that the temple is dedicated to the goddess of the sea and protector of sailors. Finish the tour with the 200-year old ancestral house, Tam Ky, and a 17th century bridge built by Japanese craftsmen. The idyllic and relaxed vibe of the town makes it a great place to walk around on foot to take in its history.
strTitle: Hoi An Half Day Private Tour

strIntroduction: Explore the important historical landmarks of Hoi An on an afternoon stroll with an experienced guide Learn about the rich culture of Hoi An on a walking tour accompanied by your English speaking guide Visit the important landmarks of the town including the Chua Ong Pagoda, Jinshang Temple and Tan Ky House Unwind at the end of the day with a boat ride along the Thu Bon River, the ancient trading hub of Hoi An Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off Learn about the rich culture of Hoi An on a walking tour accompanied by your English speaking guide Visit the important landmarks of the town including the Chua Ong Pagoda, Jinshang Temple and Tan Ky House Unwind at the end of the day with a boat ride along the Thu Bon River, the ancient trading hub of Hoi An Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Set out on foot to discover the hidden local gems of Hoi An in a day. Enjoy the laidback atmosphere making it the perfect setting for a stroll to take in the historical architecture. Begin your journey with the Chua Ong Pagoda, built in 1653 in honor of the Chinese general, Quan Cong, and still worshipped as a symbol of loyalty and justice today. Continue on your walk until you come across the Jinshang Temple and Tan Ky House, a 200 year old ancestral home, and a 17th century covered bridge built by Japanese craftsmen with a beautiful and intricate design. All the while, your English speaking guide will be relating an animated history of the sites you stroll past. End your journey with a relaxed boat trip along the Thu Bon River, which served as the central port of the ancient Champa dynasty.

Enjoy a relaxing bicycle ride through Vietnamese countryside on an unforgettable rural adventure in Hoi An Ride through Hoi An's stunning countryside and learn about the life of local farmers Visit authentic little villages where you will get to try out locals' typical daily activities: watering gardens, picking vegetables and more Hop on a boat for a memorable voyage to Cam Thanh coconut village Choose between three convenient options: a 3 hour, a 5 hour or a full day tour Ride through Hoi An's stunning countryside and learn about the life of local farmers Visit authentic little villages where you will get to try out locals' typical daily activities: watering gardens, picking vegetables and more Hop on a boat for a memorable voyage to Cam Thanh coconut village Choose between three convenient options: a 3 hour, a 5 hour or a full day tour What We Love:   What We Love: Explore the natural and cultural splendor of Vietnam in full with a bike ride through Hoi An's picturesque countryside. Pedal past paddy rice fields, small quaint villages and atmospheric gardens. You will have three amazing options to choose from. The 3 hour Experience At Tra Que Herb Village will introduce you to all the intricacies of a farmer's life: from watering the ground to picking greens. The longer Cam Thanh Village Cycling Tour In Hoi An will teach you how to dry and smoke fish and let you paddle a traditional boat through the exotic waterways of Cam Thanh coconut village. For a complete experience, take both these in for a whole day of countryside activities in Hoi An on the full day tour.

Find out about the historical city of Hoi An in this tour that explores the most significant places of interest and local craft sites Visit many of Hoi An's top sightseeing spots in just one day See and learn about Chua Ong Pagoda, Jinsheng Temple, Tam Ky House and more Enjoy a relaxing cruise and visit a craft village near Hoi An Your enthusiastic local guide will offer you incredible insights into the history of this beautiful city Lunch and air conditioned hotel transfers are included Visit many of Hoi An's top sightseeing spots in just one day See and learn about Chua Ong Pagoda, Jinsheng Temple, Tam Ky House and more Enjoy a relaxing cruise and visit a craft village near Hoi An Your enthusiastic local guide will offer you incredible insights into the history of this beautiful city Lunch and air conditioned hotel transfers are included What We Love:   What We Love: Delve deep into Hoi An's history to learn how a 16th century port transformed into the quaint old quarter that exists today. Visit a number of the city's famous landmarks, starting with the Chua Ong Pagoda, built in 1653 to honor the Chinese general Quan Cong. Afterwards, you'll be whisked along to the majestic Jinshang Temple in the Phuc Kien Assembly Hall to witness the spiritual ambience of this marvellous landmark. Tam Ky House is next on the agenda - an ancient ancestral house famed for it's memorable yellow exterior. Make sure you've got a camera to hand when you walk over the 17th century Japanese bridge - a powerful symbol of Japan's fine craftsmanship. If you're starting to get tired after all this walking, sit back and relax on the boat cruise down to a craft village. You'll be able to watch traditional artisans make ceramics right before your eyes, before heading down to the docks to soak up scenes of local life on the water.

strIntroduction: Learn how to cook signature Vietnamese dishes, bargain at a local market, pick organic vegetables, ride a boat and more Master the best of Vietnamese cuisine from spring rolls and papaya salad to claypot pork and rice pancakes in a interactive cooking class Go shopping at a local market, sharpen your bargaining skills and buy organic produce from a small village Your road to lunch is paved with fun: participate in a boat racing competition, row through an exotic forest and more Master the best of Vietnamese cuisine from spring rolls and papaya salad to claypot pork and rice pancakes in a interactive cooking class Go shopping at a local market, sharpen your bargaining skills and buy organic produce from a small village Your road to lunch is paved with fun: participate in a boat racing competition, row through an exotic forest and more What We Love:   What We Love: Learn how to cook stunning Vietnamese dishes on a half day tour of Hoi An. You will start with a visit to the local market to pick up ingredients - but not only that: while there, try mastering a few bargaining techniques and learn the basics of Vietnamese shopping vocabulary. Then, go on to visit Cam Thanh village to get organic vegetables for your cooking master class later. Before you get to cook, though, lots of other adventures await: you will ride in a basket boat, take part in a boat racing competition, catch fish with rods and a traditional net and row through a coco palm forest. During the two hour cooking class, you will learn to make deep fried spring rolls, papaya salad with shrimp crackers, pork or fish in a clay pot with steamed rice and Banh Xeo (rice pancake with fresh salad) with seasonal fruit for dessert.

The nine hour trip takes you through the rich historical past of Hoi An and you will get to see an abundance of sights: the 400 year old Japanese Bridge, a 300 year old Chinese temple, a 200 year old Vietnamese merchant's house, the local fish market and more. After a quick lunch, hop on a cyclo and enjoy beautiful natural landscapes while riding through Vietnamese countryside. Go on a relaxing two hour boat ride to Cua Dai estuary, passing fields and fruit gardens.

Known for its citadels, palaces, toms and royal pagodas, it's the perfect spot to learn about the city's rich imperial past and cultural heritage. This quiet and romantic city will instantly win you over with its unique atmosphere and vibe. Start with a visit to Hue's famous 200-year old citadel before going on a relaxing voyage down Perfume River. Don't miss exploring Thien Mu Pagoda and Minh Mang Tomb before heading to Dong Ba Riverside Market.

Meet up at 3:00pm and cycle through authentic Hoi An neighborhoods and visit rice field villages. Marvel at the magnificent Chuc Thanh Pagoda founded in 1454 by a Buddhist monk from China - this is the oldest pagoda in Hoi An. Sample 9 delicious local dishes at 5 tasting spots and head back for well earned rest at 8:00pm.

strIntroduction: Monkey Mountain...Angels' Landing? Son Tra Peninsula has many names and even more reasons to visit it! Get ready for breathtaking, postcard views - Son Tra Peninsula is nature's masterpiece Explore the 13.5 kilometer mountain pass and the stunning views that surround it Visit old American radar stations dating back to the 60's Trek through a forest to an ecotourism base and relax over a delicious lunch Get ready for breathtaking, postcard views - Son Tra Peninsula is nature's masterpiece Explore the 13.5 kilometer mountain pass and the stunning views that surround it Visit old American radar stations dating back to the 60's Trek through a forest to an ecotourism base and relax over a delicious lunch What We Love:   What We Love: Son Tra Peninsula boasts stunning natural landscapes and quite a few names. During their occupancy, the French named it Angels' Landing. Later, American soldiers nicknamed the 13.5 kilometer-long pass Monkey Mountain (travel to Son Tra and find out why). But what's in a name? With beautiful mountain caves and mysterious pagodas, this place is a must-see, whatever the name is. Your trip starts early in the morning with a hotel pick up and ride to Son Tra Peninsula, from where you will be enjoying panoramic sea views of Da Nang. From there, you will go on to visit old radar stations and trek through a forest to Nhat Lam Thuy Trang Tra ecotourism site. After a filling lunch, get ready to see some top sights near Da Nang: Nai Vang stream and Linh Ung temple

This exotic experience has it all: delicious food, hidden backstreet spots and a unique method of transportation - a fast and furious motorbike! Hop on and travel through the streets of Da Nang and discover its most delicious secrets. You will be introduced to a total of 5 tasting locations and sample 8 amazing dishes that promise to get you full and satisfied at lunch or dinner. Enjoy a trip full of flavors until you've found your favorite Vietnamese cuisine.
strTitle: Da Nang Food Tour By Motorbike

strIntroduction: Learn to cook up to six traditional Cambodian meals including a refreshing Mango Salad, a mouth-watering Fish Amok, crispy spring rolls and sweet Sticky Rice Balls for dessert Learn to create three (AM or PM class) or six (full day course) delicious Cambodian dishes led by a local chef Visit a local family at a rural village to learn about daily cooking in a Khmer household Classes accommodate a maximum of 6 students, each with a private workstation Receive recipe cards so you can recreate the delicious dishes when you return home Enjoy complimentary hotel pick-up and return transfer back to town by tuk tuk Learn to create three (AM or PM class) or six (full day course) delicious Cambodian dishes led by a local chef Learn to create three (AM or PM class) or six (full day course) delicious Cambodian dishes led by a local chef Visit a local family at a rural village to learn about daily cooking in a Khmer household Visit a local family at a rural village to learn about daily cooking in a Khmer household Classes accommodate a maximum of 6 students, each with a private workstation Classes accommodate a maximum of 6 students, each with a private workstation Receive recipe cards so you can recreate the delicious dishes when you return home Receive recipe cards so you can recreate the delicious dishes when you return home Enjoy complimentary hotel pick-up and return transfer back to town by tuk tuk Enjoy complimentary hotel pick-up and return transfer back to town by tuk tuk What We Love:   What We Love: Taking a cooking class is an unmissable experience when in Siem Reap. Memories of those mouthwatering Cambodian flavors will stay with you long after you return home. These classes start with a nice touch: a visit to a local family. You'll take a stroll through the village, learn about homegrown herbs and vegetables and discover more about cooking in a Khmer household. A gift of rice is provided to the family as thanks for their participation. Then it's time to get stuck in! Together with your local chef and guide, you'll get a hands-on cooking experience with tips and recipe cards so you can reproduce the dishes at home. Mango salad, fresh spring rolls, Cambodian curry and tasty desserts are some of your menu choices. And the best part? You can taste all your creations once the cooking's over!

What comes to mind when you hear ‘Angkor'? Temples of course! This day tour takes you to Siem Reap's most beautiful temples, led by a local guide, a wealth of knowledge on the subject Visit Cambodia's most spectacular temples of Ta Prohm, Bayon and of course, Angkor Wat Enjoy a hot Cambodian picnic lunch in a shaded area by a temple Appreciate the knowledge and friendliness of your local Khmer guide With tour groups of no more than 8 - or even better, a private tour - you can be sure that you won't be visiting sights en masse Enjoy complimentary hotel pick-up and return transfer back to town Visit Cambodia's most spectacular temples of Ta Prohm, Bayon and of course, Angkor Wat Visit Cambodia's most spectacular temples of Ta Prohm, Bayon and of course, Angkor Wat Enjoy a hot Cambodian picnic lunch in a shaded area by a temple Enjoy a hot Cambodian picnic lunch in a shaded area by a temple Appreciate the knowledge and friendliness of your local Khmer guide Appreciate the knowledge and friendliness of your local Khmer guide With tour groups of no more than 8 - or even better, a private tour - you can be sure that you won't be visiting sights en masse With tour groups of no more than 8 - or even better, a private tour - you can be sure that you won't be visiting sights en masse Enjoy complimentary hotel pick-up and return transfer back to town Enjoy complimentary hotel pick-up and return transfer back to town What We Love:   What We Love: Temples, temples, temples… well, that is why you're in Siem Reap after all. This tour is hands down the best way to explore Cambodia's incredible feats of religious architecture. Visit Ta Prohm temple, where ancient stones and massive tree roots are locked in battle, then it's onwards to Angkor Thom ancient walled city and the mystical Bayon temple adorned with hundreds of smiling faces carved into the sandstone. Roam further into the temple complex and immerse yourself in stories told by your local Khmer guide before seeking out a shaded area to enjoy a hot Cambodian picnic lunch. End the tour with a bang: a visit to the jewel of the Khmer Empire, the amazing Angkor Wat. Founding inscriptions are plentiful but the mystery lies in how this great empire collapsed. Reflect on Cambodia's troubled history and contemplate the secrets as you stroll through this masterpiece of architecture and engineering.

Watch in absolute awe at the talents of these young performers as they juggle, dance, perform acrobatic and aerial acts, and use fire and contortion in an explosive show, certain to blow you away Witness incredible feats of traditional and modern theater Watch the show from the most exclusive viewpoint, with front and center seats reserved just for you Receive a bottle of water prior to the performance and a special gift from the Phare Boutique afterwards Support a charitable organization, dedicated to preserving Cambodian arts and helping disadvantaged local youngsters Witness incredible feats of traditional and modern theater Witness incredible feats of traditional and modern theater Watch the show from the most exclusive viewpoint, with front and center seats reserved just for you Watch the show from the most exclusive viewpoint, with front and center seats reserved just for you Receive a bottle of water prior to the performance and a special gift from the Phare Boutique afterwards Receive a bottle of water prior to the performance and a special gift from the Phare Boutique afterwards Support a charitable organization, dedicated to preserving Cambodian arts and helping disadvantaged local youngsters Support a charitable organization, dedicated to preserving Cambodian arts and helping disadvantaged local youngsters What We Love:   What We Love: This traditional Cambodian performance is a phenomenon not to miss! You'll be left in absolute awe at the talents of these brilliant young performers. An amazing blend of traditional and modern theater, music, dance, acrobatics, juggling and contortion all beautifully choreographed in a story about Cambodian lives and society. Though performed in Khmer with English subtitles on a screen, the story is easy to follow without words and you'll probably be too enthralled by the performers to keep up with the narrative anyway! If you're still not convinced, the thousands of five star reviews online should be enough to persuade you. The show is a project of the PPS Association, a non-profit organization founded by eight young Cambodian ex-refugees of the Khmer Rouge regime, committed to reviving the Cambodian arts.

This 145km Cambodian motorbiking adventure will not only seriously pump up your adrenalin and let you ride freely through the beautiful countryside but it'll give you a good dose of historical insight too! Discover the true Cambodia, far from the tourist trails, with a full-day motorbike tour Visit the historical Phnom Kulen where the 'Age of Angkor' began, swim in a waterfall and see a giant reclining Buddha Take in the incredible scenery of the Kulen Mountain plateau and visit hidden temples Practice riding before setting off or share the bike with your experienced guide instead Tap into the local knowledge of your Khmer guide and make the most of his translator skills! Tap into the local knowledge of your Khmer guide and make the most of his translator skills! What We Love:   What We Love: Up for an adventure? If you're feeling daring and want to really get off-road, we've got the perfect tour for you. Drive to the place where it all began, where Jayavarman crowned himself godking in 802AD. Rich in history, Phnom Kulen is where the ‘Age of Angkor' began, and is one of only two places in Cambodia where Buddha is reputed to have set foot. Visit a giant reclining Buddha and a scenic waterfall (don't forget your swimwear!) Then push on further, exploring kilometers of complex back trails, deep jungle tracks and hidden temples, including the stunning and sought-after stone elephant and lion statues. Tours are fully customizable, so if you want to take it easier, an alternative route takes you to the isolated pagoda of Preah Kral, with beautiful views of the Kulen Mountain plateau. This is the ultimate moto experience but if you're not feeling confident, not to worry, just hop on the back of the guide's bike instead.

This unforgettable morning cycle guides you through the back trails among the ruins of the Angkor Kingdom. With an early start, you'll join a small group of early risers eager to see the sunrise. Once they've returned to bed, you'll have the rest of the morning to explore the Angkor temples in the soft dawn light and, most welcomingly, without the tourist crowds. Follow your guide on a walking tour of Angkor Wat before settling down for a peaceful breakfast just outside the temple grounds. Once you're revitalized, the rest of the day will be spent riding the back trails through ruins and forests, with stops at both iconic and lesser-known temples including Bayon and Ta Prom. You'll take lunch by a small reservoir then as the day heats up, you'll drive back to town and your hotel.

Or simply because you're on holiday! This is Siem Reap's most unique dining experience, perfect for couples and small groups of friends. Your own private chef will cook a three-course meal, just for you, which you'll enjoy in a private pavilion. Begin with a welcome drink over sunset then relax with a glass of wine as you watch dusk turn into night. Bamboo flares and candle lighting create a romantic atmosphere, and your personal waiter will ensure you have the perfect evening.
